text: To determine if there exists an integer \( x \) such that \( x^3 = 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \) for some integer \( n \), we start by analyzing the expression \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \).
class-1-reason: The paragraph is setting up the problem by explaining the aim and rephrasing the task using given parameters. It proceeds with a methodical approach toward solving the problem.
class-2-reason: The sentence sets up the task of analyzing the given mathematical expression.

class-1-reason: The paragraph describes a specific procedure to evaluate the expression modulo 9, covering all possible residue cases systematically. It directly contributes to solving the problem using a known strategy.
class-2-reason: The sentence suggests a step to consider the problem modulo 9, indicating a course of action.

text: We will evaluate \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \mod 9 \) for \( n = 0, 1, 2, \ldots, 8 \) since these residues cover all possible cases for \( n \mod 9 \).
class-1-reason: The paragraph describes a specific procedure to evaluate the expression modulo 9, covering all possible residue cases systematically. It directly contributes to solving the problem using a known strategy.
class-2-reason: The sentence outlines the specific step to evaluate the expression for different residues modulo 9.

text:
\[
\begin{align*}
n \equiv 0 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 1 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(1) + 3(1) + 7 \equiv 13 \equiv 4 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 2 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(4) + 3(2) + 7 \equiv 25 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 3 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(9) + 3(3) + 7 \equiv 43 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 4 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(16) + 3(4) + 7 \equiv 67 \equiv 4 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 5 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(25) + 3(5) + 7 \equiv 97 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 6 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(36) + 3(6) + 7 \equiv 133 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 7 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(49) + 3(7) + 7 \equiv 175 \equiv 4 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 8 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(64) + 3(8) + 7 \equiv 223 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}.
class-1-reason: This paragraph computes sub-results for each possible residue and explicitly uses mathematical calculations within a planned framework. It systematically carries out computations contributing directly to the problem solution.
class-2-reason: The sentence performs calculations to find the result for each value of n modulo 9.

text: Next, we consider the possible values of \( x^3 \mod 9 \).
class-1-reason: The paragraph introduces the next phase of solving the problem by stating it will evaluate potential values for another component, preparing for another systematic examination step without speculative or exploratory language.
class-2-reason: The sentence indicates the next step in the problem-solving process, considering values of x.

class-1-reason: The paragraph introduces the next phase of solving the problem by stating it will evaluate potential values for another component, preparing for another systematic examination step without speculative or exploratory language.
class-2-reason: The sentence outlines the next step to compute values of x modulo 9.

text:
\[
\begin{align*}
x \equiv 0 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 0 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 1 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 1 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 2 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 8 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 3 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 27 \equiv 0 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 4 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 64 \equiv 1 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 5 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 125 \equiv 8 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 6 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 216 \equiv 0 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 7 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 343 \equiv 1 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 8 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 512 \equiv 8 \pmod{9}.
class-1-reason: This paragraph systematically computes the cube of integers modulo 9, which is part of the standard setup for solving the problem.
class-2-reason: The sentence performs the calculation of x cubed for different residues modulo 9.

text: The possible values of \( x^3 \mod 9 \) are \( 0, 1, 8 \).
class-1-reason: The paragraph directly states the results of previously computed values without further exploration or verification.
class-2-reason: The sentence analyzes the possible values of x^3 modulo 9 by presenting a conclusion based on mathematical properties.

text: Since \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 4 \) or \( 7 \pmod{9} \) and \( x^3 \equiv 0, 1, 8 \pmod{9} \), there is no overlap between the possible values of \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \mod 9 \) and \( x^3 \mod 9 \).
class-1-reason: The solver logically concludes that there's no overlap between possible values, directly progressing in solving the main problem.
class-2-reason: The sentence concludes that there is no overlap in possible values by analyzing the congruences modulo 9.

text: Therefore, there does not exist an integer \( x \) such that \( x^3 = 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \) for any integer \( n \).
class-1-reason: This paragraph clearly presents the conclusion of the problem-solving process.
class-2-reason: The sentence provides a conclusive statement based on the previous analysis, confirming the impossibility of a solution.
